data.title: Same birthdays
data.solution:
N=input()
# compute the inverse probability, i.e. that no two people in the groupe have
# their birthday on the same day
p=1
for i in range(1,N):
    p *= float(365-i)/365
# the result is 1 minus that inverse probability
print int((1-p)*100)+1
data.statement:
Your program must output the probability that at least two persons in a group have their birthday on the same day.
The year is assumed to have 365 days and no person in the group is born on a February 29th.

Hint: this is linked to the probability that *no* two people in the group have their birthday on the same day.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1>>:  [[N]], the number of persons in the group.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1>>: [[P]] the probability that two persons in a group of [[N]] persons have their birthday on the same day, expressed in percent and rounded to the integer above (e.g. 53.2% becomes 54).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your program must output the probability that at least two persons in a group have their birthday on the same day.
The year is assumed to have 365 days and no person in the group is born on a February 29th.

Hint: this is linked to the probability that *no* two people in the group have their birthday on the same day.
Input
Line 1: N, the number of persons in the group.
Output
Line 1: P the probability that two persons in a group of N persons have their birthday on the same day, expressed in percent and rounded to the integer above (e.g. 53.2% becomes 54).
Constraints
2 <= N <= 100
Example
Input
2
Output
1
